generif.text: The progressive loss of PHLDA1 expression in melanomas may play a role in deregulated cell growth and apoptosis resistance in these tumors.
expression of TDAG51 in human T-cells does not correlate with activation-induced cell death
TDAG51 plays an important role in the anti-apoptotic effects of IGF-I.
TDAG51 locus shows an operon-like organization of two head-to-head oriented transcripts that are inversely regulated in T lymphocytes by a CpG-rich bidirectional promoter.
Reduced PHLDA1 expression is important in breast cancer progression and could serve as useful prognostic marker of disease outcome.
TDAG51 in patients with intractable epilepsy was significantly higher when compared with levels in the controls.

The anti-estrogen ICI 182,780 (1 microM) inhibited PHLDA1 mRNA expression and completely abolished the effect of 10 nM 17beta-estradiol on PHLDA1 expression (P < 0.05), suggesting that PHLDA1 is regulated by estrogen via ER.
PHLDA1 expression marks the putative epithelial stem cells, downregulates ITGA2 and ITGA6, and contributes to intestinal tumorigenesis
crucial negative regulator and effector of Aurora A kinase in breast cancer
the release of Ca(2+) from endoplasmic reticulum stores mediates epithelial-to-mesenchymal transition in human proximal tubular epithelium via the induction of TDAG51
PHLDA1 differentiates between desmoplastic trichoepithelioma and morpheaform basal cell carcinoma but shows variable staining in microcystic adnexal carcinoma.
The follicular stem cell marker PHLDA1 (TDAG51) indicates that most basaloid tumors in nevus sebaceus are basal cell carcinomas and not trichoblastomas.
PHLDA1 expression is a useful addition in differentiating trichoblastoma and basal cell carcinoma.
Data show that downregulation of aurora A kinase by the therapeutic antibody is associated with decreased levels of MYCN protein in cytoplasm, and induced expression of PHLDA1 and P53 proteins.
A role for PHLDA1 as an apoptosis suppressor in oral cancer cells.

Data suggest that high PHLDA1 expression is controlled through an ER-NFkappaB-miR-181 regulatory axis and may contribute to a poor clinical outcome in patients with ER+ breast tumors by enhancing stem-like properties in these tumors.
Suggest decreased expression of PHLDA1 may play an important role in tumor progression, and may become a new adjunct biomarker in the prognosis in gastric adenocarcinoma.

Our study negatively correlates expression of PHLDA1 and Aurora A in IMR-32 cells and sheds new light on functions of PHLDA1 in the neuroblastoma tumor cells, suggesting its role as a pro-apoptotic protein
that PHLDA1 downregulation in MCF10A cells leads to morphological changes and a more aggressive behavior
suggest a unique regulatory feature of PHLDA1 to inhibit the ErbB receptor oligomerization process and thereby control the activity of receptor signaling network.
PHLDA1 is a biomarker for drug response.

there was no virtual stimulation of autophagy in the 14G2a mAb-treated CHP-134 neuroblastoma cells, we were able to show that PHLDA1 protein positively regulates autophagy and this process exists in a mutually exclusive manner with apoptosis in PHLDA1-silenced CHP-134 cells.

Data identified PHLDA1 as a novel p53 target with an ability to repress Akt. PHLDA1 has a so-called split PH domain divided into an N-terminal and a C-terminal portions and seems to be responsible for its localization to the plasma membrane and binding to phosphatidylinositol. In addition, PHLDA1 expression analysis suggests that PHLDA1 has a tumor suppressive function in breast and ovarian cancers.
TDAG51 (T-Cell Death-Associated Gene 51) Is a Key Modulator of Vascular Calcification and Osteogenic Transdifferentiation of Arterial Smooth Muscle Cells.
Prognostic and predictive value of Pleckstrin homology-like domain, family A family members in breast cancer.
BMP4 and PHLDA1 are plausible drug-targetable candidate genes for KRAS G12A-, G12D-, and G12V-driven colorectal cancer.
PHLDA1 promotes glioblastoma cell growth via sustaining the activation state of Ras.
PHLDA1 is a P53 target gene involved in P53-mediated cell apoptosis.
Restoration of the ER stress response protein TDAG51 in hepatocytes mitigates NAFLD in mice.

name: pleckstrin homology like domain family A member 1
other_names: pleckstrin homology-like domain family A member 1
summary: This gene encodes an evolutionarily conserved proline-histidine rich nuclear protein. The encoded protein may play an important role in the anti-apoptotic effects of insulin-like growth factor-1. [provided by RefSeq, Jul 2008].
